wikipedia_page.main: Joyce Scott Lindores (2 May 1944 – 18 June 2017) was a Scottish international indoor and lawn bowler.

The Women's World Championship took place in Cumbernauld from April 5–7. The event was sponsored by Churchill Insurance and was won by Joyce Lindores.

link_mentions.page: Lawn bowls at the 1994 Commonwealth Games

response: Letham has won medals at four World Outdoor Championships. Starting with a pairs gold with Joyce Lindores in 2000 in Moama, Australia and then a singles bronze four yeasr later in Leamington Spa. The third medal came eight years later when she was part of the four that won gold in Adelaide, the four consisted of Letham, Caroline Brown, Lynn Stein and Michelle Cooper. At the same event she also won the pairs bronze partnering Claire Johnston.

link_mentions.page: 2000 World Outdoor Bowls Championship – Women's pairs
response: The gold medal was won by Margaret Letham & Joyce Lindores of Scotland.
She won a silver medal in the pairs with Joyce Lindores at the 2006 Commonwealth Games in Melbourne.
